intro: Cynoglossum multicaule, commonly known as the clustered dead-nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces numerous stems that bear the flowering clusters. Cynoglossum multicaule is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
